intro: Ervatamia cordata, commonly known as heartleaf vervain, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and spikes of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value. Ervatamia cordata is also valued for its ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
